A11yGoat
Perceivable

Color contrast checkers are one of the few automatic auditing tools that work well. Make use of Chrome’s Accessibility Developer Tools to check the page for color contrast issues.
* Chrome’s Accessibility Developer Tools
That will tell you which are bad, but to experience it is even better. Make use of Chrome’s High Contrast extension and set the page to greyscale

Probably a more prevalent color issue is cases where the colors convey important information. Under these circumstances you will need to either change the graphic or provide an additional means of obtaining the same information.
